titleStmt.title: Joshua F. Bell et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10588

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency, B McGoffin, Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned members of the bar of Mercer County, & others, respectfully petition Your Excellency to pardon James Duddleston who was convicted at the last term of the Mercer Circuit Court, of stabbing L Gabhart, as we believe his case presents strong consideration for Execution interposition
Duddleston never should have been convicted for felonious stabbing

William Davis
Fon T Fox
James.H. Moore
C. McAfee
Garret Terhune
William Atkins
E. J. Polk
Ben C. Trupnall
O S. Poston
James D Randin
Wm A. Hool
Thos E Miller
Jno P Haggin
C. C. Smedley
Josuha F Bell
M. J. Dunham
Ben C. Allin
C. Graham
J. A. Thompson
M B. Pulliams
